intro: Cissampelos pareira var. nephrophylla, commonly known as the kidneyleaf moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in humid environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitats.
